Human health is reportedly a key concern at pet markets due to the attendance of the public, and because many animals are likely to harbour transmissible zoonotic pathogens.
1, 2 Zoonotic diseases are pathogenic infections and infestations transmissible from animals to humans. There are around 200 zoonoses
3 and approximately 40 of these are associated with amphibians and reptiles (for examples, see Appendices A and B). Captive reptiles are routinely identified as reservoirs of infectious bacteria, for example, Salmonella,
4 and all reptiles should be presumed to harbour Salmonella.
